attributes.action: Make CPR and basic life support part of the national curriculum
attributes.additional_details:
Every minute counts during a cardiac arrest and as nurses with over 60years combined experience we have seen the ramifications of delayed or poor CPR. Early good CPR can triple a person’s chances of survival. Teaching school children COR and basic life support could equip a whole generation and future generations with lifesaving skills. 
We believe this training should be a mandatory & assessed part of the national curriculum across ALL UK nations to ensure consistent, lifesaving skills for all
attributes.background: We want the government to make COR and basic life support part of the national curriculum for all school children in the U.K.

rejection.details: Please see this written answer for more information: https://questions-statements.parliament.uk/written-questions/detail/2023-06-06/188058
